snippet: The average temperature across the contiguous United States for the first six months of 2012 has been the warmest on record dating to 1895, according to a report released Monday.
abstract: National Climatic Data Center reports that the average temperature across the contiguous United States for the first six months of 2012 has been the warmest on record dating to 1895.
lead_paragraph: The average temperature across the contiguous United States for the first six months of 2012 has been the warmest on record dating to 1895, according to a report released Monday.

headline.main: First Half of Year Hottest on Record
headline.print_headline: First Half of Year Hottest On Record
